summary: This document is a Fourth Amendment to the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One, executed by Jeffrey E. Epstein in 2007. It removes Ghislaine Maxwell and Ira Zicherman as successor co-Trustees and replaces them with Darren K. Indyke, Joseph Pagano, and Lawrence Newman.

keyFacts: In 2007, Jeffrey Epstein removed Ghislaine Maxwell and Ira Zicherman from positions of fiduciary responsibility (successor co-Trustee) in his 2001 trust.
Epstein replaced Maxwell and Zicherman with three new successor co-Trustees: Darren K. Indyke, Joseph Pagano, and Lawrence Newman.
This document shows Epstein actively managing his trust structure and changing key personnel with control over his assets.
The trust had been amended previously in 2003, 2004, and 2006, indicating ongoing modifications to Epstein's financial and estate planning.
The amendment was notarized by Karen J. Kwintner in New York, providing legal authentication for the change.
